sentences.en: "Helen had something to eat before she left," put in Cecil anxiously.
sentences.cn: “海伦走之前吃了点儿东西，”塞西尔急忙插了一句。

sentences.en: "Oh, Gairdner," he said, as if that meant something to him.
sentences.cn: “哦，盖尔德纳，”他说道，好像他听说过这个名字。

sentences.en: A miracle is something that seems impossible but happens anyway.
sentences.cn: 奇迹就是看似不可能，却发生了。

sentences.en: By golly we can do something about it this time.
sentences.cn: 这次我们确实可以采取行动了。

sentences.en: Her new film is something else.
sentences.cn: 她的影片非常独特

sentences.en: I don’t know what he does exactly, but I know it has something to do with computers (= is related to them in some way ) .
sentences.cn: 我不知道他具体是干什么的，只知道和电脑有关。

sentences.en: If you're not satisfied with the life you're living, don't just complain. Do something about it.
sentences.cn: 对于现况的不满，不能只是抱怨，要有勇气作出改变。

sentences.en: Ludlam was responsible for making Ridiculous Theatre something of a cult.
sentences.cn: 荒诞派戏剧的风靡要归功于勒德拉姆。

sentences.en: Our professor is something of an eccentric.
sentences.cn: 我们教授的性情多少有点儿古怪

sentences.en: people think I'm stupid because I think there's something in this alien business.
sentences.cn: 人们觉得我蠢笨，因为我觉得这个外国企业真的值得考虑。

sentences.en: Sarah said something about coming over later.
sentences.cn: 萨拉说她等一会儿过来什么的。

sentences.en: She's nervous about something, in case you didn't notice.
sentences.cn: 她正为了什么事神经紧张，你连这个都没看出来？

sentences.en: So, if we could just move onto something else?
sentences.cn: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？

sentences.en: Something must have gone wrong with the satellite link.
sentences.cn: 卫星连接一定出了毛病。

sentences.en: The city proved to be something of a disappointment.
sentences.cn: 结果这座城市有点儿令人失望。

sentences.en: the reaction from the crowd was something else.
sentences.cn: 人群的反应特别异常。

sentences.en: the reaction from the crowd was something else.
sentences.cn: 人群的反应特别异常。

sentences.en: Then something seemed to snap in me. I couldn't endure any more.
sentences.cn: 这时候，我的心里像有个东西突然绷断了——我再也忍受不了啦。

sentences.en: There are bound to be teething problems with something so new.
sentences.cn: 如此新鲜的事物刚开始必然会有些问题。

sentences.en: There's something about the way he talks of her that doesn't fit.
sentences.cn: 他谈论她的样子有点不对劲。

sentences.en: There’s something in my eye.
sentences.cn: 我眼睛里有什么东西。

sentences.en: They've picked up a really nasty infection from something they've eaten.
sentences.cn: 他们因吃错东西而得了很严重的感染症。

sentences.en: This is something of a grudge match against a long-term enemy.
sentences.cn: 这可以说是一场与宿敌你死我活的比赛。

sentences.en: you look like you just climbed a mountain or something.
sentences.cn: 你看上去好像刚爬过山或是什么的。

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)不寻常的事；值得注意的事
(非正式)异常的人（或事）；特别出色的人（或事）
非常特殊或者非常了不起的人（或事物）
不劳而获之利益；轻易得来的利益
有几分；有点儿；可以说是一个
[口语] 我猜疑，我感到，我想
[美国口语] 制造麻烦；引起争吵(或打斗)

trans.tran_cn: 重要的人；值得重视的事
trans.tran_en: used to admit that someone’s words are true or their ideas are successful etc

trans.tran_cn: 某物，某事，（表示不确切的描述或数量）大致，左右，想来重要（或值得注意）的事物
trans.tran_en: used to mean a particular thing when you do not know its name or do not know exactly what it is
